Class CommandPacket

java.lang.Object
server_core.CommandPacket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CommandPacket extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a data packet exchanged between client and server. Includes a command string, optional arguments, an optional table of data, a response status code, and a description message.

Typical usage: - Client sends a CommandPacket with command and arguments. - Server responds with a CommandPacket containing a status code and optional data.

Status codes:

  • 200 - ✅ OK
  • 201 - ✅ Created
  • 204 - ✅ No Content
  • 400 - ❌ Bad Request
  • 401 - ❌ Unauthorized
  • 403 - ❌ Forbidden
  • 404 - ❌ Not Found
  • 409 - ❌ Conflict
  • 500 - ❌ Internal Server Error
  • 503 - ❌ Service Unavailable
See Also:

    • getCommand

      public String getCommand()
      Returns:
      The command string (e.g., LOGIN, CREATE, REPORT).

    • getArgs

      public Map<String,String> getArgs()
      Returns:
      A map of key-value arguments related to the command.

    • getTable

      public List<Map<String,String>> getTable()
      Returns:
      A list of rows, where each row is a map representing a table of data.

    • getAnswer

      public int getAnswer()
      Returns:
      The response status code (e.g., 200, 400, 500).
